蜝字的基本解释

蜝
qí
古同“蜞”。

蜝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qí］
［《廣韻》渠之切，平之，羣。］
亦作“蜞1”。
(1)见“蟛蜞”。
(2)水蛭，马蝗。

蜝字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蜝； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1086第01
【韻會】渠之切【正韻】渠宜切，?音其。【玉篇】蟚蜝也。【集韻】似蟹而小，不可食。【晉書·蔡謨傳】初渡江，見蟚蜝，大喜，曰：蟹有八足，加以二螯令烹之，旣食，吐下委頓，方知非蟹。謝尚曰：卿讀《爾雅》不熟，幾爲《勸學》死。　又雷蜝，蟲名。【酉陽雜俎】雷蜝，大如蚓，以物觸之，乃蹙縮，圓轉若鞠，良久引首，鞠形漸小，復如蚓焉。　又馬蜝。【本草】水蛭大者名馬蜝。　【類篇】或作蜞。

考證：〔【晉書·蔡謨傳】初渡江，見蟚蜝，大喜曰，蟹有二螯八足，加以二螯烹之。〕　謹照原文蟹有下省二螯兩字。烹上增令字。
蜝字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
蜝字的起名意思

暂无。

qí
The ancient same "cup".
Centipede
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qí］
["Guangyun" Qu Zhiqi, Ping Zhi, Qun. ]
Also known as "City 1".
(1) See "Wedelia".
(2) Leeches, horse locusts.
Centipede
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蜝; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1086 01
[Rhyme Club] Qu Zhiqie [Zheng Yun] Qu Yiqie, sound its. 【Jade articles】Fats are also. 【Jiyun】It is small like a crab, not edible. [Jin Shu·Cai Mo Biography] When I first crossed the river, I saw the worms, and I was overjoyed, saying: Crabs have eight legs, add two claws to cook them, eat, and vomit, then you will know that they are not crabs. Xie Shang said: Qing was unfamiliar with "Er Ya", and almost died of "Encouraging Learning".　Thunder again, insect name. 【Youyang Miscellaneous】Thunder worm is as big as an earthworm, touches it with an object, but shrinks, turns round like a ju, leads for a long time, and the shape of the ju becomes smaller and complex like an earthworm.　Horse again. 【Materia Medica】The big leech is called horse centipede.　【Classification】Or as a scorpion. Textual research: [[Jin Shu·Cai Mo Biography] When I first crossed the river, I saw the worms. I was overjoyed and said that crabs have two claws and eight legs, and they are cooked with two claws. 〕 　 I would like to say that according to the original text, there is the word "Xia Sheng Er Cao". Add the word on cooking.
